actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to provide Federal assistance to encourage community and neighborhood artistic and cultural activities, to promote sound urban design, and to contribute to neighborhood conservation and revitalization, and for other purposes.
subjects: Federal aid to the arts and humanities

summary.text: Livable Cities Act - States the purpose of this Act to be to further the efforts of urban communities and organizations to revitalize such communities both commercially and culturally. Authorizes the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to make grants to, or contract with, nonprofit organizations for projects which the Secretary, in consultation with the Chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts, determines will carry out the purposes of this Act and which have substantial artistic, cultural, or urban design merit and represent community or neighborhood initiatives to revitalize such communities. Directs the Secretary and the Chairman to develop criteria for selecting programs to be assisted under this Act. Provides program guidelines and eligibility requirements for assistance under this Act. Authorizes appropriations for such programs for fiscal years 1979 and 1980.

titles.title: A bill to provide Federal assistance to encourage community and neighborhood artistic and cultural activities, to promote sound urban design, and to contribute to neighborhood conservation and revitalization, and for other purposes.
